column4: ok question: if i instal, for example MOZILLA SUITE, i have a lot of other dependencies to install with it...total 104MiB, so if I remove Mozilla, how do i remove all the dependencies, without writing em all down!?
in synaptic you can choose a view "orphaned packages" (if you have deborphan installed, too) - this could help you
or what hogs the memory (type M when u use top)
